abstract: The success of social networking and mobile apps has venture capitalists racing to invest in young companies, but some question whether they will make money.
snippet: The success of social networking and mobile apps has venture capitalists racing to invest in young companies, but some question whether they will make money.
lead_paragraph: In a memorable scene in the “The Social Network,” the actor Justin Timberlake, who portrays the Silicon Valley investor Sean Parker in the movie, leans over the table and tells the founders of Facebook in a conspiratorial tone: “A million dollars isn’t cool. You know what’s cool? A billion dollars.”

headline.main: A Silicon Bubble Shows Signs of Reinflating

byline.original: By Jenna Wortham and Evelyn M. Rusli
